intro: Astragalus curvipes var. transitorius, commonly known as the transient milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant has compound leaves with numerous leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
